Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can illustrate a fish and the habitat where it lives.
The student can label the water environment the fish lives in, such as a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can represent and label at least one resource the fish needs to survive, like water or other living things.
The student can show and label other plants or animals that might be in the same habitat as the fish.
The student can draw arrows or other indicators to demonstrate relationships between the fish, its habitat, and the resources it uses.
The student can illustrate how the different parts of the habitat work together to meet the fish's needs, showing the system.
